level.text: The Executive Director may provide selection slips at no cost to the players.
Selection slips are provided solely for the convenience of players and shall have no monetary or prize value or constitute evidence of a bet or of the numbers selected.
If a selection slip is used, the player shall do the following:
Select the requisite number of squares for each single lettered board for that game;
Indicate the “Quick Pick” option on the selection slip;
Present a selection slip for a combination “Quick Pick” and manual selection; or
Indicate a combination of “Quick Pick” and other methods.
The requisite numbers and the associated letter constitute a single game board on a selection slip.
Game boards may be selected in any order.
Selection slips shall be processed through the terminal by the agent, and tickets shall be issued only through the terminal.
If the selection slip is rejected by the terminal, the wager is not valid and the player may submit another selection slip.

The use of facsimiles of selection slips, copies of selection slips, or other materials that are inserted into the terminal’s selection slip reader and are not printed by the Agency or approved by the Executive Director shall be prohibited.
No device shall be connected to a lottery terminal to enter bets except as may be approved by the Executive Director.
All bets using selection slips shall be marked on the selection slip by hand. No machine printed selections slips shall be used to enter bets.
